While they can be a handful for less experienced owners, their dedication and cleverness make them a joy for those who understand their need for work and play. The profuse coat, especially the sporty 'collarette' around the neck, is more pronounced in males, who are generally larger than females. Overall, the Belgian Tervuren is a versatile and spirited breed that thrives on activity and companionship.

data.general.name: Bloodhound
data.general.shortDescription: The inquisitive, amicable Bloodhound excels at tracking scents and is a gentle, affectionate family companion.
data.general.longDescription:
The Bloodhound, renowned as the 'Sleuth Hound,' is unparalleled in its ability to track scents, making it the ultimate tracker in the canine world. Standing between 23 to 27 inches and weighing up to 110 pounds, this breed is both large and substantial.
Their distinctive appearance features a long, wrinkled face, loose skin, large drooping ears, and warm, deep-set eyes that give them a dignified, solemn expression. Bloodhounds' coats come in black and tan, liver and tan, or red, and their powerful legs enable them to cover vast terrains in their quest to follow a scent.
Despite their tenacity when tracking, Bloodhounds are some of the most docile and friendly dogs when off-duty. They have an affectionate nature, enjoying the company of their family, including other dogs and children. While they are easygoing, their independent and inquisitive nature can sometimes lead them into mischief, driven by their incredible sense of smell.
It's important to provide them with long walks and opportunities to explore scents. However, be prepared for drooling and the challenges of training such a sensitive and stubborn sleuth. With the right care, a Bloodhound makes a loving and loyal companion, always ready to follow their nose on the next adventure.

data.general.name: Anatolian Shepherd
data.general.shortDescription: The Anatolian Shepherd Dog is a loyal, autonomous, and imposing flock guardian.
data.general.longDescription:
The Anatolian Shepherd Dog, a member of the Working Group, is a majestic and imposing guardian of ancient lineage. Standing at around 30 inches tall and weighing up to 115 pounds, these muscular dogs are revered for their protective and territorial nature. Known for their faithfulness and reticence, Anatolians are autonomous and highly intelligent, making them exceptional working guard dogs.
Their history dates back 6,000 years to the Bronze Age, giving them a timeless, no-frills quality. Anatolian Shepherds are incredibly loyal and will protect their flock—be it livestock, children, smaller dogs, or even the family cat—with unwavering intensity. Despite their large size and muscular build, they are nimble and well-adapted to harsh terrains.
However, they require strong leadership from their owners, who must be willing and able to manage a dog as dominating and demanding as he is calm and loving. Anatolians are moderately adaptable and require a balance of physical activity and mental stimulation. While not particularly affectionate with family members, their dedication and protective instincts make them invaluable companions for those who understand and appreciate their unique traits.

data.general.name: German Wirehaired Pointer
data.general.shortDescription: The German Wirehaired Pointer is an eager, loving, and observant sporting breed.
data.general.longDescription:
The German Wirehaired Pointer, with its sporty weatherproof coat and can-do attitude, is a versatile and sturdy gundog perfect for outdoor enthusiasts. This breed stands tall at around 25 inches and weighs about 60 pounds, making it slightly larger than its close relative, the German Shorthaired Pointer. Known for their eagerness and affection, GWPs make amusing and devoted family companions.
Their balanced, well-muscled build and resilience allow them to thrive in active environments, tirelessly working through the bushes all day. The harsh wire coat provides protection against thorny underbrush and adverse weather, while their distinctive shaggy beard and eyebrows add to their intelligent and worldly expression. High in energy, GWPs need plenty of outdoor activity and will not be content lounging indoors all day.
They are bright and eager to learn, but their independent streak might be challenging for novice owners. Ideal for those seeking a loving companion who enjoys sports and togetherness, the German Wirehaired Pointer is a perfect match for active families who appreciate their spirited and observant nature.

data.general.name: Belgian Sheepdog
data.general.shortDescription: The Belgian Sheepdog is a resolute, intelligent herder with an elegant, muscular build and abundant black coat.
data.general.longDescription:
The Belgian Sheepdog, a highly trainable herder, stands out with its resolute and intelligent nature. Known for its versatility and legendary canine intelligence, this breed thrives on hard work and relishes human companionship. The striking silhouette of the Belgian Sheepdog exudes elegance and muscular determination, with males reaching up to 26 inches at the shoulder.
Their dark eyes gleam with a questioning intelligence, while their abundant black coat features a distinctive 'collarette' around the neck and 'breeches' on the hindquarters. These dogs are bright-eyed and bushy-tailed, always ready to give 100% in any sport or activity. Sensitive souls, Belgian Sheepdogs dislike neglect and form intense bonds with their owners, who often feel a profound loyalty towards their devoted companions.
With their proud carriage, playful demeanor, and protective instincts, Belgian Sheepdogs are not just working dogs but passionate, loyal partners in every sense.

data.general.name: Gordon Setter
data.general.shortDescription: The Gordon Setter is a brave, self-assured, and loving sporting dog.
data.general.longDescription:
The Gordon Setter, known as the black avenger of the Highlands, is an impressive bird dog with roots in Scottish aristocracy. This athletic and outdoorsy breed is renowned for its bravery, confidence, and affection. Standing up to 27 inches tall and weighing around 80 pounds, Gordon Setters are the largest of the setter breeds.
They are distinguished by their stunning, silky black coats with striking tan markings and long hair adorning their ears, belly, legs, chest, and tail. Their bright brown eyes, highlighted by tan spots, convey a wise and willing expression.
Built to endure Scotland's rugged terrain and harsh weather, these dogs are equally happy in the field or by the fireside. They have a high activity level, making them perfect for active families who enjoy outdoor adventures. Gordons are known for their protective instincts and are very easy to train, which complements their loving nature towards family members.
Their adaptability and moderate vocalization frequency make them well-suited for various living environments. However, regular grooming is needed to maintain their beautiful coat. Whether hunting in the wild or relaxing at home, the Gordon Setter's bold and affectionate demeanor makes them a cherished companion for those seeking a loyal and spirited dog.

data.general.name: Italian Greyhound
data.general.shortDescription: The Italian Greyhound is an observant, vigilant, and jovial toy companion with elegant, slender lines.
data.general.longDescription:
The Italian Greyhound, often referred to as an IG, is a true Greyhound in miniature form, renowned for its grace and elegance. Standing at about 15 inches tall and weighing around 10 pounds, this breed captivates with its sleek, curving lines and long, fine-boned legs. Despite their petite stature, Italian Greyhounds are alert, playful, and highly affectionate companions, making them ideal for families and individuals alike.
Their affectionate nature means they thrive on close human contact, often preferring to snuggle in a lap or share a bed. Known for their keen observational skills and vigilance, they are also quite playful and social, getting along well with children and other dogs. However, they retain the instinctual drive of their larger Greyhound relatives and will eagerly chase after anything that moves swiftly.
Their smooth, short coat requires minimal grooming but demands extra warmth during colder months. With a lifespan of up to 15 years, these charming and loyal dogs are perfect for those seeking a devoted and lively companion.

data.general.name: Border Terrier
data.general.shortDescription: Brave, loving, and joyful, Border Terriers are hardy and affectionate companions with a distinctive otter-like head.
data.general.longDescription:
The Border Terrier is a charming blend of bravery, love, and joy, making them a beloved companion for families and individuals alike. Standing around 14 inches tall and weighing about 14 pounds, this small yet sturdy breed is known for its unique otter-shaped head and longer legs compared to other small terriers. Their wiry, rough coat, which can come in colors like grizzle and tan, blue and tan, wheaten, or red, is easy to maintain and adds to their rugged appeal.
Despite their compact size, Border Terriers possess a toughness that shines through in their work ethic, whether they're out in the fields or playing in the backyard. At home, they are affectionate and good-natured, getting along well with children and other dogs, though their hunting instincts might kick in around smaller animals. Adaptable to city living, these terriers thrive on regular exercise and mental stimulation.
Their moderate activity level, coupled with their friendly demeanor, makes them excellent playmates and loyal companions. With a lifespan of around 14 years, Border Terriers promise many years of tail-wagging joy and steadfast companionship.

data.general.name: Flat-Coated Retriever
data.general.shortDescription: The Flat-Coated Retriever is an entertaining, joyful, and positive companion with a forever-young spirit.
data.general.longDescription:
The Flat-Coated Retriever, often called the 'Peter Pan' of the Sporting Group, is a delightful and entertaining breed known for its joyful and positive personality. Standing at 25 inches tall and weighing around 65 pounds, this breed exudes elegance with its lean silhouette and smooth, wavy, flat-lying coat, available in lustrous black or liver. The Flat-Coat's distinctive long head projects a smart and kindly expression, adding to its charm.
These dogs are champions of tail-wagging and possess a playful nature that often makes them seem perpetually young, much to the delight of their families. They are highly energetic and thrive on ample outdoor exercise, making them perfect for active households. Flat-Coats are affectionate, great with children, and sociable with other dogs, ensuring they are beloved family members.
Their adaptability, ease of training, and willingness to please make them a joy to have around. Whether retrieving a duck or winning a show ribbon, these dogs do it all with enthusiasm and grace. Their zest for life and playful antics can be both entertaining and a bit mischievous, making them an endearing and lively addition to any home.

data.general.name: Chinese Crested
data.general.shortDescription: The Chinese Crested is a loving, vigilant, and vibrant companion with a unique hairless appearance.
data.general.longDescription:
The Chinese Crested is a charming and distinctive breed known for its unique appearance and delightful personality. Standing at about 12 inches tall and weighing around 10 pounds, this small but spirited companion is beloved for its loving and vigilant nature. The hairless variety, with its spotted pink skin, spiky 'crested' hairdo, furry socks, and feathery tail, is particularly eye-catching.
There is also a coated variety known as the 'powderpuff,' which boasts a soft, silky coat. Despite their differing looks, both types of Cresteds share the same fine-boned elegance and graceful movement.
Cresteds are incredibly affectionate and form strong bonds with their families, making them excellent companions. Their playful and vibrant demeanor brings joy and energy to any household. These dogs are relatively easy to train, adaptable, and moderately active, making them suitable for a variety of living situations.
The hairless variety is especially low-maintenance when it comes to grooming and shedding, while the powderpuff's silky coat requires more frequent brushing. Known for their attentiveness and sociability, Chinese Cresteds are wonderful housemates, always in tune with their human companions. With a lifespan of around 15 years, these delightful dogs offer years of loving companionship and playful antics.

data.general.name: Portuguese Water Dog
data.general.shortDescription: Dynamic and loving, the Portuguese Water Dog is a smart, easy-to-train, curly-coated companion.
data.general.longDescription:
The Portuguese Water Dog, or PWD, is a dynamic and loving breed known for its intelligence and eagerness to please. Originally bred as an all-around fisherman's helper, this robust, medium-sized dog has a curly, low-shedding coat that suits its love for water work. Standing around 20 inches tall and weighing about 45 pounds, PWDs are incredibly versatile and thrive on mental and physical stimulation.
Their high adaptability and trainability make them excellent companions for families, especially those with children. PWDs are playful, brave, and protective, displaying strong loyalty and affection toward their family members. They are sociable with other dogs and friendly toward strangers, making them well-rounded pets.
Despite their rough, curly fur requiring regular grooming, their low shedding is a plus for those concerned about fur around the home. With their high activity levels and need for mental challenges, Portuguese Water Dogs are best suited for active owners who can keep up with their energetic and adventurous spirit.

data.general.name: Greyhound
data.general.shortDescription: Greyhounds are elegant, gentle sprinters with a noble presence and an independent spirit.
data.general.longDescription:
The Greyhound, a stately member of the Hound group, is celebrated for its grace, speed, and gentle nature. With a height of around 30 inches and a weight of about 65 pounds, this breed showcases a lean, aerodynamic build that epitomizes the dog breeder's adage, 'Form follows function.' Their deep chest curves gracefully into a tightly tucked waist, creating the classic 'inverted S' silhouette that has captivated artists, poets, and royalty for millennia.
Known for their independent yet tender demeanor, Greyhounds are affectionate with their families, scoring a 4 out of 5 on family affection. They adapt well to various living situations and have a moderate level of protective instincts. While they are relatively easy to train and enjoy mental stimulation, their true love lies in running, making their activity level a notable 4 out of 5.
Despite their athletic prowess, Greyhounds are surprisingly low-maintenance, with minimal shedding, infrequent grooming needs, and a smooth, short coat. These gentle sprinters are equally sociable with other dogs and enjoy a moderate level of playfulness, making them excellent companions for those who appreciate a dog with a blend of autonomy and tenderness.

data.general.name: Old English Sheepdog
data.general.shortDescription: The Old English Sheepdog is a wise, adaptable, and tender herding breed with a distinctive shaggy coat.
data.general.longDescription:
The Old English Sheepdog, a member of the herding group, is an adaptable and tender breed known for its iconic shaggy coat and peek-a-boo hairdo. Standing about 20 inches tall and weighing around 80 pounds, this breed boasts a muscular and compact frame, with a bear-like gait that showcases its agility and strength. Beneath their profuse double coat lies a kind and wise dog, famed for its mellow and agreeable nature.
The Old English Sheepdog is especially cherished for its excellent family qualities, showing a high level of affection and patience with children, making them protective and playful companions. They are sensible watchdogs with a loud, ringing bark, embodying a perfect blend of courage, intelligence, and kindliness. While they have moderate activity levels, regular exercise is essential to keep these strong and able-bodied dogs happy.
Their rough, wavy coat requires frequent grooming to maintain its health and appearance, making them a high-maintenance yet rewarding breed. Overall, the Old English Sheepdog is a charming and devoted family member, known for its watchfulness and endearing personality.

data.general.name: St. Bernard
data.general.shortDescription: Saint Bernards are inquisitive, jovial giants known for their captivating, friendly nature and patience with children.
data.general.longDescription:
The Saint Bernard, a genial giant hailing from the Swiss Alps, is renowned for its friendly and inquisitive nature. Standing tall at a minimum of 27.5 inches and weighing around 145 pounds, this breed is extraordinarily muscular and imposing.
With a lifespan of about 9 years, Saint Bernards are famous for their patience and affection, especially towards children, making them ideal family companions. Despite their size, they adapt well to various living conditions and are moderately easy to train, though they do have a tendency to drool. Their smooth, wavy double coat requires moderate grooming, and they shed a fair amount.
Saint Bernards are moderately active and playful, requiring regular mental stimulation. With low vocalization tendencies, these captivating dogs are friendly yet protective, ensuring their family is safe while maintaining a welcoming demeanor towards strangers. Their giant hearts match their giant size, making them beloved members of any family.

data.general.name: Papillon
data.general.shortDescription: The joyful and vigilant Papillon is a small, amiable companion with distinctive butterfly-like ears.
data.general.longDescription:
The Papillon, named after the French word for 'butterfly,' is a captivating toy breed known for its joyful and vigilant nature. Standing at about 10 inches tall and weighing around 8 pounds, this tiny yet robust dog is a bundle of energy and charm.
One of its most striking features is its large, wing-shaped ears, which can either be erect or, in the Phalene variety, gracefully drooped. The Papillon's silky, straight coat, typically in a variety of color combinations with a white base, adds to its elegant appearance.
Despite its refined look, the Papillon is a hardy and adaptable breed, thriving in both urban and rural settings and in various climates. These dogs are incredibly affectionate, scoring high in family affection and child-friendliness. Their friendly demeanor extends to strangers, making them welcoming companions.
Highly intelligent and eager to please, Papillons excel in training and are known for their agility and ability to learn tricks quickly. Their high activity level and mental stimulation needs make them ideal for active families.
Papillons are also protective, often alerting their owners to any unusual activity with their frequent vocalizations. They are playful and enjoy engaging in family activities, making them delightful additions to any household.
Whether participating in high-level agility competitions or simply joining in on family fun, the Papillon is a versatile and loving companion for all seasons and reasons.

data.general.name: Whippet
data.general.shortDescription: The serene and loving Whippet is a swift, low-maintenance, and affectionate companion.
data.general.longDescription:
The Whippet is a sleek, sweet-faced breed known for its incredible speed and graceful appearance. Often referred to as the 'Poor Man's Racehorse,' this breed is lightning quick and loves to chase. Standing about 20 inches tall and weighing around 35 pounds, Whippets resemble a smaller Greyhound with their streamlined 'inverted S' body shape, deep chest, trim waist, and long, arched neck.
Their serene and jovial nature makes them a loving companion, perfect for families and children, earning a top rating in family affection and child-friendliness. They enjoy playfulness and mental stimulation, often requiring bursts of intense activity followed by long, relaxed lounging. Ideal for both fenced yards and cozy apartments, Whippets adapt well as long as they get proper exercise.
They are low-maintenance with minimal shedding and grooming needs, and their quiet demeanor makes them excellent for city living. Overall, Whippets are dignified, gentle, and robust dogs that bring joy and elegance to any home.

data.general.name: American Bulldog
data.general.shortDescription: American Bulldogs are brave, faithful, and self-assured working dogs with great strength and agility.
data.general.longDescription:
The American Bulldog is a robust and athletic breed, admired for its strength, endurance, and agility. With a history rooted in farm work, this breed was originally brought to the United States by immigrants in the 1800s. Known for their bravery and faithful nature, American Bulldogs were indispensable to small farmers and ranchers, performing tasks such as guarding property, herding livestock, and catching feral pigs.
Their muscular build and smooth, straight coat give them a distinctive appearance. Despite their protective instincts, they are also known for their friendly and self-assured demeanor. Although not highly vocal, they can be quite alert and responsive.
Their moderate size, weighing around 80 pounds and standing 23 inches tall, combined with their low grooming needs, make them a manageable breed for those who appreciate a hardworking, loyal companion. While they may not be highly playful or adaptable, their loyalty and dedication make them a cherished member of any household.

data.general.name: Rhodesian Ridgeback
data.general.shortDescription: The Rhodesian Ridgeback: a serene, stately, and loving hound with a distinctive back ridge.
data.general.longDescription:
The Rhodesian Ridgeback, often referred to as the 'Renaissance hound,' is a serene, stately, and loving breed known for its hallmark ridge of backward-growing hair along its back. Originally famed in Africa for its prowess in tracking and baying lions, the Ridgeback has transitioned into a cherished family companion. Weighing between 70 to 85 pounds and standing around 25 inches tall, these powerful athletes exhibit remarkable speed and strength.
Their sleek, smooth coat comes in shades of wheaten, complemented by either black or less common brown noses. Ridgebacks are known for their independence and strong prey drive, requiring firm but fair guidance from an early age. Despite their formidable presence, they are incredibly affectionate and protective towards their family.
While they are excellent with children and adaptable to various environments, their strong-willed nature means they can be challenging for novice dog owners. With moderate activity levels and a need for mental stimulation, Rhodesian Ridgebacks make loyal and affectionate companions for those prepared to handle their unique blend of independence and devotion.

data.general.name: AmStaff
data.general.shortDescription: American Staffordshire Terriers are wise, benevolent, and self-assured companions with a muscular build and confident gait.
data.general.longDescription:
The American Staffordshire Terrier, affectionately known as the AmStaff, is a smart, confident, and good-natured breed. These dogs are celebrated for their courage and loyalty, making them trustworthy friends to the end. Standing around 18 inches tall and weighing about 60 pounds, AmStaffs are stocky and muscular, with broad heads, defined jaws, pronounced cheekbones, and dark, round eyes set wide apart.
Their agile, graceful movement and springy gait highlight their innate confidence. The stiff, glossy coat can come in various colors and patterns, and is low-maintenance, shedding minimally and requiring infrequent grooming.
AmStaffs are keenly aware of their surroundings, always ready for a challenge, and are often described as 'personality dogs' due to their affectionate nature. They are well-suited for families, showing high levels of affection and friendliness toward strangers, although their protective instincts make them excellent watchdogs. These dogs enjoy both mental and physical stimulation and are highly trainable, with many excelling in showbiz and other activities.
When considering adding an AmStaff to your family, it's essential to find a responsible breeder to ensure a well-socialized and healthy companion.

data.general.name: Scottish Terrier
data.general.shortDescription: The Scottish Terrier is a confident, vivacious, and autonomous breed with a vivid personality.
data.general.longDescription:
The Scottish Terrier, affectionately known as the Scottie, is a compact and sturdy breed bursting with personality. Standing at about 10 inches tall and weighing around 20 pounds, these little dogs are known for their independence and confidence. Their dignified, almost human-like character, combined with their persistent terrier spirit, has earned them the nickname 'the Diehard.
' The Scottie's silhouette is unmistakable, with its short legs, substantial body, and distinctive furnishings on the beard, legs, and lower body. Their wiry topcoat, paired with a soft, dense undercoat, can be black, wheaten yellow, or brindle-striped, giving them a unique and charming appearance.
Scotties are known for their bright, piercing eyes, erect ears, and tail, which convey their keen alertness, a hallmark of Britain's terrier breeds. They have a businesslike, efficient working style and are aloof towards strangers, making them excellent watchdogs. However, their strong hunting instincts can be a challenge, particularly around smaller animals like cats.
Scotties can also be somewhat cantankerous with other dogs. Despite these traits, they are incredibly affectionate with their families, scoring high on family affection levels.
These bold and clever dogs thrive on mental stimulation and enjoy brisk walks and playful activities. With their lively nature and spirited disposition, the Scottish Terrier makes a delightful and loyal companion for those who appreciate their unique blend of independence and affection.

data.general.name: Wire Fox Terrier
data.general.shortDescription: The Wire Fox Terrier is a sociable, vigilant, and self-assured companion with a rough, wiry coat.
data.general.longDescription:
The Wire Fox Terrier is a lively, spirited breed known for its sociable, vigilant, and self-assured nature. Standing around 15 inches tall and weighing about 17 pounds, these dogs pack a lot of personality into a small, sturdy frame.
Their rough, wiry coats are predominantly white, adding to their distinctive, irresistible appearance. With a lifespan of approximately 14 years, Wire Fox Terriers are not only long-lived but also low-shedding, making them an excellent choice for families seeking an energetic yet manageable pet.
Once the stars of traditional British foxhunts, Wire Fox Terriers have transitioned into charming and amusing companions. Their dark, round eyes exude intelligence and a fiery spirit, and their V-shaped ears, neatly folded forward, add to their distinctive look.
Highly affectionate and child-friendly, they make wonderful family pets. They are also highly adaptable and trainable, although their natural terrier independence and prey drive can pose challenges.
Wire Fox Terriers are enthusiastic athletes and natural comedians, bringing joy and laughter to their households. Their high activity level and need for mental stimulation mean they thrive in environments where they can stay busy and engaged.
With their playful demeanor and friendly attitude towards strangers, they are delightful companions for anyone looking for a dog with loads of personality and charm.

data.general.name: Vizsla
data.general.shortDescription: The Vizsla is a tender, vivacious, and loving sporting dog with a sleek golden-rust coat.
data.general.longDescription:
The Vizsla is a versatile, red-coated gundog known for its elegant yet rugged build, perfect for long days in the field. Standing between 21 to 24 inches tall and weighing around 55 pounds, these athletic dogs are the pride of Hungarian sportsmen, with increasing popularity. Their sleek, golden-rust coat and smooth, straight fur, combined with their lean and light-footed physique, make them instantly recognizable.
Vizslas are affectionate and form deep bonds with their owners, thriving on human companionship and hating to be left alone. They are vivacious, loving, and eager to please, excelling in various sports and activities due to their high energy levels and great stamina. Ideal jogging or biking companions, Vizslas require significant mental stimulation and physical activity.
Their long, silky ears frame a sensitive and loving expression at home, transforming into intense focus when working. Known for their trainability and adaptability, these dogs are perfect for families, being child-friendly and sociable with other dogs. If you have the time and energy to dedicate to a Vizsla, you'll find a loyal and playful companion that brings joy and adventure into your life.

data.general.name: Pekingese
data.general.shortDescription: The Pekingese, a regal, loyal, and loving toy breed with a distinctive rolling gait and lion-like mane.
data.general.longDescription:
The Pekingese, a compact toy breed with an air of regal sophistication, hails from ancient China, where they were cherished by the ruling classes. Standing at 8 inches tall and weighing around 12 pounds, these little dogs are known for their stately presence and unique rolling gait.
Their long, silky coat, particularly full around the neck and shoulders, forms the characteristic 'lion's mane,' and comes in various shades of red, from golden to deep mahogany. Pekingese have a distinctive head shape with a broad, short muzzle and large, dark, sparkly eyes that add to their expressive charm.
Known for their loyalty and loving nature, Pekingese form deep bonds with their favorite humans. Despite their small size, they possess a confident and independent demeanor, reminiscent of the emperors who once owned them.
These dogs are ever-alert and make excellent watchdogs, displaying a protective instinct that belies their stature. They are generally adaptable and moderately easy to train, though their 'opinionated' nature might require some patience.
While Pekingese can tolerate children, they prefer gentle handling and can be less tolerant of rough play. Their moderate activity level and low vocalization frequency make them well-suited to apartment living. Regular grooming is essential to maintain their luxurious coat, but their low salivation tendency and charming personality make them delightful companions.
Overall, the Pekingese is a sophisticated, faithful, and loving breed that thrives as a close, cherished companion.

data.general.name: Great Pyrenees
data.general.shortDescription: The Great Pyrenees is a majestic, serene guardian, known for its strength, wisdom, and tolerance.
data.general.longDescription:
The Great Pyrenees is a majestic breed, exuding a serene and wise demeanor that belies its immense strength and tolerance. Originally bred to guard sheep from predators on snowy mountaintops, this working dog remains a vigilant protector and a mellow companion in modern homes. Standing tall at up to 30 inches and weighing around 95 pounds, the Great Pyrenees combines powerful physicality with a calm, Zen-like presence.
Their lush, weatherproof coat, often pure white or marked with shades of gray, tan, reddish-brown, or badger, adds to their regal appearance. Despite their calm nature, these dogs can swiftly spring into action to address any threats, moving with surprising grace and speed. Affectionate with family and highly protective, they are moderately adaptable and benefit from regular mental and physical stimulation.
Though they require moderate grooming and shed seasonally, their loyal and gentle nature makes them wonderful companions. Ideal for those seeking a steadfast, tolerant, and wise guardian, the Great Pyrenees is a breed that blends historical purpose with modern companionship beautifully.

data.general.name: Alaskan Malamute
data.general.shortDescription: The Alaskan Malamute is a strong, loving, and jovial sled dog with a weatherproof coat and a dignified demeanor.
data.general.longDescription:
The Alaskan Malamute is an immensely strong and heavy-duty worker of the spitz type, instantly recognizable by its well-furred, plumed tail carried over the back, erect ears, and substantial bone structure. Standing at 25 inches tall and weighing around 80 pounds, this breed boasts a dense, weatherproof coat, heavy bone, deep chest, and powerful shoulders that highlight its origin as an arctic sled dog. Despite their robust build and working capabilities, Malamutes are known for their affectionate, faithful, and playful nature.
Their almond-shaped brown eyes sparkle with affection, showing their love for snuggling with their human families after a long day. These dogs are pack animals and thrive on firm but loving training, which should start in early puppyhood. Without proper guidance, a Malamute might try to assert dominance.
When well-trained, they are a joy to be around—playful, gentle, friendly, and excellent with children. Their balance of work ethic and affectionate nature makes them a delightful and reliable companion.

data.general.name: Havanese
data.general.shortDescription: The Havanese is a cheerful, clever, and sociable companion with a silky coat and lively personality.
data.general.longDescription:
The Havanese, the only dog breed native to Cuba, is a delightful little companion known for its cheerful demeanor and sociable nature. Standing at about 10 inches tall and weighing around 10 pounds, these sturdy yet compact dogs are characterized by their springy step and bright, expressive eyes.
The Havanese sports a distinctive curled-over tail and a luxurious silky coat that comes in various colors. Owners have the option of keeping their coats long and silky, cording them like a Puli, or clipping them short for easier grooming, but either way, Havanese dogs are always charming.
These intelligent and trainable dogs are renowned for their entertaining and playful antics, often acting like little clowns to the delight of their families. Their adaptability makes them excellent city dogs, but they thrive anywhere they can bask in the attention of people. Despite their small size, Havanese make vigilant watchdogs, alerting their families to any unusual activity, although they usually keep their barking to a reasonable level.
Friendly with children, other dogs, and strangers, Havanese are the perfect family dogs. Their playful and affectionate nature ensures they bond well with all members of the household, providing years of joy and companionship.
With a lifespan of around 15 years, these lively, lovable dogs are sure to bring a lifetime of happiness to any home they join.

data.general.name: Chinese Shar-Pei
data.general.shortDescription: The Chinese Shar-Pei is a serene, autonomous, and faithful companion with unique physical traits.
data.general.longDescription:
The Chinese Shar-Pei is a remarkable breed known for its serene demeanor, autonomy, and steadfast loyalty. Originating from ancient China, this medium-sized dog stands out with its distinctive appearance: a broad 'hippopotamus' muzzle, blue-black tongue, small sunken eyes, and tiny triangular ears. Its abundant folds of loose skin around the head, neck, and shoulders, along with a harsh, sandpapery coat, give it a truly unique look.
The name Shar-Pei translates to 'sand skin,' reflecting its rough-textured coat. Weighing around 55 pounds and standing about 20 inches tall, the Shar-Pei is both strong and regal, making it an excellent guardian. Known for their intelligence and independence, Shar-Pei are deeply loyal to their families but tend to be wary of strangers and other dogs.
While generally calm, they will respond to threats with tenacity and vigor. Early training and socialization are crucial for this breed to prevent dominance issues. With a moderate activity level and adaptability, the Shar-Pei is well-suited to various living environments, provided they receive proper training and care.
This fascinating breed is a unique companion, blending ancient pedigree with a dignified and protective nature.

data.general.name: Afghan Hound
data.general.shortDescription: The Afghan Hound: an elegant, autonomous, and tender breed with a regal appearance and silky coat.
data.general.longDescription:
The Afghan Hound is one of the most strikingly beautiful breeds, known for its elegant and aloof demeanor. With a height of up to 27 inches and a weight of around 55 pounds, this breed commands attention with its long, silky coat and dignified presence. Originally from the mountainous regions, the Afghan Hound's luxurious coat served as protection against harsh climates.
Despite their aristocratic look, Afghan Hounds have a playful side and exhibit deep loyalty to their families. They are known for their autonomy and can sometimes be reserved, making them more suitable for experienced dog owners who appreciate their unique personality. Their activity level is high, requiring ample exercise and mental stimulation to keep them happy.
While they might be challenging to train, their affectionate nature and tender interactions make them endearing companions. Afghan Hounds are a special breed, perfect for those who can provide the care and environment they need to thrive, embodying both beauty and a captivating personality.

data.general.name: Basset Hound
data.general.shortDescription: The Basset Hound is a serene, captivating, and tolerant companion with a distinctively charming appearance.
data.general.longDescription:
The Basset Hound, an endearing member of the hound group, is instantly recognizable and adored worldwide. With a height of 15 inches and a weight of around 55 pounds, this low-slung, low-key hound exudes big-dog strength and stamina in a small package. Known for their serene, captivating, and tolerant personality, Basset Hounds are ideal for families and sociable environments, though they can exhibit a stubborn streak.
Their distinctive look includes a large, domed head, velvety long ears, mournful eyes, and a wrinkled brow, giving them a charming, almost sad clown appearance. Built for endurance rather than speed, they move with a deliberate but effortless gait and possess an exceptional sense of smell, second only to the Bloodhound. At home, they are mild and agreeable, displaying their loyalty through steadfast companionship.
While their barking can be loud and frequent, their overall demeanor remains calm and collected. Despite a tendency to drool and moderate shedding, the Basset Hound's smooth, short coat is easy to maintain, making them a delightful and manageable pet for many households.

data.general.name: Australian Cattle Dog
data.general.shortDescription: The Australian Cattle Dog is an energetic, clever herder with a loyal, persistent nature.
data.general.longDescription:
The Australian Cattle Dog (ACD), also known as the Blue or Red Heeler or Queensland Heeler, is a compact yet muscular breed renowned for its herding prowess. Standing at about 20 inches tall and weighing around 45 pounds, this agile and strong dog is closely related to the wild Dingo. Born with a white coat that transforms into blue-gray or red, often adorned with distinctive mottling or speckling, the ACD is both visually striking and highly functional.
Renowned for their intelligence and cleverness, these dogs can sometimes outsmart their owners. Their boundless energy and persistent nature make them excellent running partners and exceptional at managing livestock. ACDs are loyal and tenacious, always alert and often wary of strangers.
They thrive on mental and physical challenges, making them well-suited for active owners who can engage them in work, sport, or regular exercise. Without adequate stimulation, they can become bored and may get into mischief. Despite a moderate level of affection for their families, they are incredibly faithful and protective.
With a smooth, straight double coat, they require minimal grooming but do shed moderately. Known for their low vocalization and minimal salivation, Australian Cattle Dogs are a unique blend of energy, intelligence, and loyalty, making them a fascinating and devoted companion for the right owner.

data.general.name: Soft Coated Wheaten Terrier
data.general.shortDescription: The Soft Coated Wheaten Terrier is a joyful, dedicated, and amicable terrier with a silky, wavy coat.
data.general.longDescription:
The Soft Coated Wheaten Terrier, originating from Ireland, is a joyful and dedicated breed known for its amiable nature and distinctive silky, wavy coat. Standing at 18 inches tall and weighing around 35 pounds, this terrier has a sturdy, square build complemented by a unique 'peek-a-boo' hairdo and charming goatee. Wheatens are deeply devoted to their families, earning a perfect score in family affection, and they are especially friendly with children.
Their coat, ranging from pale beige to shimmering gold, is low-shedding but requires regular grooming to prevent matting. These merry extroverts are highly active, needing plenty of exercise and mental stimulation to stay happy. They balance their playfulness with a protective instinct, making them alert yet friendly companions.
While they can be a bit stubborn, their trainability is moderate, and their adaptable nature suits various living environments. With a lifespan of about 13 years, the Soft Coated Wheaten Terrier promises years of joyous companionship, embodying the spirit of an 'iron fist in a velvet glove.'

data.general.name: Lhasa Apso
data.general.shortDescription: The Lhasa Apso is a regal, entertaining, and wise companion with a luxurious, silky coat.
data.general.longDescription:
The Lhasa Apso, an ancient breed originating from the Himalayan region, has been captivating dog lovers for over a thousand years. Renowned for its lavishly long, silky coat that drapes elegantly on either side of its body, this small yet sturdy dog stands at about 10 inches tall and weighs around 15 pounds. Lhasas are more than just their beautiful appearance; they are known for their entertaining and self-assured nature, making them delightful family companions.
Their history as sentinels in palaces and monasteries is evident in their protective instincts and confident demeanor. Lhasas form deep bonds with their families, showing immense affection and loyalty, while remaining regally aloof with strangers.
Their dark, oval-shaped eyes, often peeking through their lush facial hair, are said to be windows to their merry and wise souls. Despite their size, they possess a strong, adaptable spirit and require moderate mental stimulation and activity. Grooming their magnificent coat does require some effort, but their minimal shedding and low salivation make up for it.
With a lifespan of about 14 years, Lhasa Apsos are long-term companions who bring joy, elegance, and a touch of ancient nobility to any household. Whether as playful family comedians or dignified protectors, Lhasa Apsos are a breed that truly stands out.

data.general.name: Chesapeake Bay Retriever
data.general.shortDescription: The Chesapeake Bay Retriever is an intelligent, loving, and observant sporting dog with a waterproof, wavy coat.
data.general.longDescription:
The Chesapeake Bay Retriever, affectionately known as the Chessie, is a quintessential sporting breed celebrated for its loyalty, intelligence, and affection. These robust dogs, standing up to 25 inches tall and weighing around 70 pounds, possess a unique waterproof, wavy coat that can be chocolatey brown, sedge, or deadgrass. Their keen yellow-amber eyes enhance their distinctive look.
Chessies are known for their strong build and tireless energy, making them exceptional hunting companions, particularly for duck retrieval in the Mid-Atlantic. With a protective instinct and an independent streak, they balance training ease with a tenacious spirit. They are moderately friendly to strangers and other dogs, making them excellent watchdogs and versatile athletes.
Despite their protective nature, they thrive on family affection and are adaptable to various living environments. Engaging and lively, Chessies require regular mental stimulation and activity, ensuring they remain happy and well-adjusted. Their rough, oily coat sheds moderately and requires regular grooming to maintain its quality.
Overall, the Chesapeake Bay Retriever is a confident, reliable companion, equally at home in the field or as a cherished family member.

data.general.name: Pointer
data.general.shortDescription: Serene, faithful, and industrious, Pointers are graceful sporting dogs and loyal companions.
data.general.longDescription:
The Pointer is the ultimate expression of canine power and grace, renowned for their serene demeanor, faithfulness, and industrious nature. With a height of about 25 inches and a weight of around 60 pounds, these athletic dogs excel in agility and speed, making them exceptional companions for runners and active families. Their smooth, straight coat is low-maintenance, shedding moderately, and comes in a variety of colors, both solid and patterned.
Pointers have been revered for centuries for their ability to point game birds, a testament to their sharp instincts and training ease. They are highly adaptable, scoring a 4 out of 5 in adaptability, and thrive in both rural and urban settings. With a lifespan of up to 15 years, these dogs are loyal and affectionate, making them excellent family pets.
Their moderate vocalization and protective instincts balance well with their sociable nature, as they are very friendly towards strangers and other dogs. Pointers require regular mental stimulation and physical activity, enjoying playful interactions and energetic exercises. Overall, Pointers are noble, graceful dogs that bring joy and companionship to any household.

data.general.name: Collie
data.general.shortDescription: The elegant and dedicated Collie is a beloved, intelligent herding dog with a storied history.
data.general.longDescription:
The majestic Collie, a breed beloved for its elegance and dedication, is one of the most recognizable and esteemed dogs in the world. Standing around 25 inches tall and weighing about 65 pounds, Collies are known for their grace and agility.
The breed comes in two varieties: the rough-coated Collie, famous for its impressive, showy coat, and the smooth-coated Collie, which boasts a subtler charm. Both varieties can be seen in a range of beautiful colors including sable and white, tricolor, blue merle, and white.
Collies are renowned for their elegant wedge-shaped heads, mobile ears, and expressive almond eyes, which convey a wide variety of emotions. They are incredibly fond of children and make excellent family pets, known for their loyalty and gentle nature.
Collies thrive on companionship and regular exercise, making them perfect for active families. Their intelligence and eagerness to please make them quick learners, especially with gentle training methods.
Although Collies require regular grooming and can be quite vocal, their affectionate and playful nature makes up for these minor demands. Their protective instincts and adaptability ensure they are always attentive and responsive to their surroundings.
Whether herding sheep or being a loving family companion, the Collie's noble character and intelligence are truly legendary.

data.general.name: Bull Terrier
data.general.shortDescription: The Bull Terrier is a playful, jovial, and captivating companion with a unique egg-shaped head.
data.general.longDescription:
Among the most comical and mischievous citizens of dogdom, the Bull Terrier is playful and endearing, sometimes stubborn, but always devoted. Standing at about 20 inches tall and weighing around 60 pounds, these unique 'eggheads' are exuberant, muscular companions who thrive on affection and exercise. Bull Terriers are robust, big-boned terriers who move with a jaunty stride suggesting agility and power.
The breed's hallmark is a long, egg-shaped head with erect, pointed ears, and small, triangular eyes that glisten with good humor. Their smooth, straight coats can be white or any other color, often featuring attractive brindle striping. A well-made Bull Terrier is the picture of muscular determination and balance.
There are four keys to Bull Terrier happiness: early socialization with dogs and people; firm but loving training; ample exercise; and lots of quality time with his adored humans. With a lifespan of around 13 years, Bull Terriers make loyal, lovable, and entertaining companions when their needs are met. Despite their moderate adaptability and training ease, they are happiest in active households where they can channel their playful energy.
Friendly to strangers and brimming with personality, Bull Terriers are the ultimate 'personality breed,' bringing endless joy and amusement to their families.

data.general.name: Irish Wolfhound
data.general.shortDescription: The serene and stately Irish Wolfhound is a brave, gentle giant, perfect for families.
data.general.longDescription:
The Irish Wolfhound, a member of the Hound group, is renowned for its serene and stately demeanor. Standing nearly 3 feet tall and weighing up to 180 pounds, this majestic breed is the tallest of all breeds. Once fearless hunters capable of taking down wolves, today's Wolfhounds are calm, agreeable companions.
Their muscular, Greyhound-like build allows for impressive speed, and their rough, hard coat comes in various colors, including white, gray, brindle, red, black, and fawn. With a family affection level of 5 out of 5, they are incredibly loving and patient, particularly with children. Despite their size, they are too gentle to serve as fierce guard dogs, though their imposing presence is often enough to deter intruders.
While they adapt moderately well to different environments and have a relatively low vocalization frequency, owning an Irish Wolfhound requires a significant commitment due to their size and moderate activity level. Their coat needs occasional grooming, and they shed moderately. The Irish Wolfhound's combination of bravery, gentleness, and grandeur makes them a unique and rewarding companion for those prepared for the commitment.

data.general.name: Irish Setter
data.general.shortDescription: The Irish Setter: a sociable, dynamic, and tender sporting dog with a gorgeous red coat.
data.general.longDescription:
The Irish Setter is a high-spirited and graceful gundog, renowned for its striking mahogany or chestnut coat. This breed stands out with its elegant, substantial build and long, sinewy legs that contribute to its swift and agile nature, making it one of the fastest sporting dogs. Irish Setters are celebrated as ideal family dogs, being sweet-tempered companions and lively playmates, especially for children.
With a friendly and outgoing personality, they effortlessly make friends with everyone they meet. Their eagerness to please and their bold, rugged nature make them excellent hunting partners. The Irish Setter thrives on mental and physical stimulation, requiring plenty of activity and positive, patient training.
For over 200 years, their lovable and playful disposition has won the hearts of sportsmen and pet owners alike. With a wavy, silky coat that demands regular grooming, these rambunctious redheads are big kids at heart, always ready for a game of fetch or a friendly adventure.

data.general.name: Cane Corso
data.general.shortDescription: Stately and clever, the Cane Corso is a loving, powerful guardian.
data.general.longDescription:
The Cane Corso is a remarkable guardian breed, exuding stately elegance and cleverness. With origins tracing back to ancient Roman times, this breed is revered for its protective nature, making it a top choice for families seeking a loyal and fearless companion. Typically standing around 25 inches tall and weighing about 50 pounds, the Cane Corso is both muscular and agile, featuring a short, smooth coat that requires minimal grooming.
Their intense loyalty and eagerness to please are balanced by a confident, assertive demeanor, making early socialization and training essential. This breed is known for its affectionate bonds with family members, scoring a high 4 out of 5 in family affection and exhibiting a protective instinct rated 5 out of 5. Though they have a moderate activity level and enjoy mental stimulation, they remain adaptable to various living situations.
Friendly yet reserved with strangers, Corsi make vigilant and discerning guardians. Their calm, competent presence, akin to a professional bodyguard, ensures a sense of security and unwavering devotion to their loved ones.

data.general.name: Chow Chow
data.general.shortDescription: The Chow Chow is a resolute, stately, and intelligent guardian with a dignified presence and unique charm.
data.general.longDescription:
The Chow Chow, an all-purpose dog of ancient Chinese origin, stands out with its muscular build and deep-chested aristocratic appearance. Known for their dignified and serious-minded nature, Chows exude an air of timeless inscrutability.
Their distinctive features include a lion-like mane around the head and shoulders, a unique blue-black tongue, deep-set almond eyes that give a scowling, snobbish expression, and a stiff-legged gait. This breed, standing up to 20 inches tall and weighing around 60 pounds, has a double coat that can be either rough or smooth, and comes in a variety of colors including red, black, blue, cinnamon, and cream.
Chow Chows are renowned for their cleanliness, often compared to cats for their fastidious nature and minimal doggy odor. While aloof with strangers, they are fiercely loyal to their families. They are well-suited for city living due to their adaptable nature and low exercise requirements.
Despite their aloof demeanor, well-socialized Chows are refined and dignified, making them excellent companions. With moderate grooming needs and a quiet disposition, the Chow Chow is a unique and noble addition to any household.

data.general.name: Cairn Terrier
data.general.shortDescription: Cairn Terriers are dynamic, vigilant, and joyful small dogs, perfect for active, affectionate families.
data.general.longDescription:
Cairn Terriers are happy, busy little earthdogs originally bred to fearlessly root out foxes and other small, furred prey in the rocky Scottish countryside. Dynamic and vigilant, these joyful companions are known for their curious nature and love of exploration. With a sturdy yet compact build, Cairns stand about 10 inches tall and weigh around 14 pounds, making them small enough for a cozy lap-snuggle yet sturdy enough for a lively romp on the lawn.
Their distinctive double coat features a harsh, wiry outer layer and a soft, downy undercoat, giving them a charmingly rugged appearance. Cairns are highly affectionate with their families, displaying a blend of playful energy and fierce loyalty. They thrive on close contact with their humans, making them ideal for households that can provide plenty of interaction and mental stimulation.
Known for their spirited independence and cleverness, Cairns can be a bit vocal but are generally adaptable and friendly with both children and other dogs. Whether they're exploring the garden or enjoying a snuggle on the couch, Cairn Terriers truly embody the terrier spirit with their gameness, independent thinking, and unwavering loyalty.

data.general.name: Basenji
data.general.shortDescription: The Basenji is a small, autonomous, and wise hound known as Africa's 'Barkless Dog.'
data.general.longDescription:
The Basenji, often called Africa's 'Barkless Dog,' is a unique and fascinating breed cherished for its intelligence, autonomy, and stately demeanor. Standing at about 15 inches tall and weighing around 25 pounds, these graceful hounds are characterized by their smooth, straight coat, tightly curled tail, and a distinctive wrinkled forehead that gives them an expressive, almost humanlike appearance. Known for their lack of barking, Basenjis communicate with a unique sound that lies somewhere between a chortle and a yodel.
Their independent nature and high activity level make them suitable for owners who can provide ample exercise and mental stimulation. Although their training can be challenging due to their catlike independence, they are clean, fastidious dogs that groom themselves meticulously. Basenjis have a moderate level of family affection and are relatively friendly to strangers, making them intriguing companions for those willing to embrace their unique personality and exercise needs.
This 'cult breed' garners singular devotion from their owners, offering a delightful blend of charm, agility, and elegance.

data.general.name: Irish Water Spaniel
data.general.shortDescription: The Irish Water Spaniel is a brave, jovial, and industrious sporting dog with a distinctive curly coat.
data.general.longDescription:
The Irish Water Spaniel, the tallest of the spaniels, stands out with its crisply curled, liver-colored coat and unique 'rat tail.' Known for their bravery and jovial nature, these industrious dogs excel both in the field and at home. Measuring 21 to 24 inches at the shoulder and weighing between 55 to 65 pounds, the Irish Water Spaniel is an agile and athletic breed.
Their waterproof coat and chiseled head topped with long, loose curls make them not only excellent swimmers but also strikingly handsome companions. These dogs are highly trainable, making them a joy to work with for experienced and novice owners alike. Affectionate with family, they are playful and loving, though they maintain a moderate level of sociability with other dogs and strangers.
Their low shedding and moderate grooming needs make them a relatively low-maintenance breed, though they thrive on mental stimulation and regular activity. With a lifespan of around 13 years, the Irish Water Spaniel offers years of companionship and joy to those who appreciate their unique blend of hard-working spirit and playful heart.

data.general.name: Polish Lowland Sheepdog
data.general.shortDescription: The Polish Lowland Sheepdog is a vibrant, intelligent, and self-assured herding breed with a shaggy coat.
data.general.longDescription:
The Polish Lowland Sheepdog, affectionately known as PON (Polski Owczarek Nizinny), is a medium-sized herding dog renowned for its intelligence, confidence, and vibrancy. Standing up to 20 inches tall and weighing around 40 pounds, this breed boasts a sturdy, muscular build. Its distinctive double coat is long and shaggy on top, with a soft, dense undercoat, often partially obscuring the eyes and adding to its unique charm.
PONs are highly adaptable, making them beloved companions for both rural and urban dwellers in Poland and beyond. They thrive on mental and physical stimulation, excelling in activities that challenge their sharp minds and energetic nature. Despite their small size, their protective instincts and alertness make them excellent watchdogs.
Though they can be a bit stubborn, their trainability is high, responding well to consistent, positive reinforcement. Regular grooming is essential to maintain their luxurious coat. With a lifespan of around 13 years, PONs are devoted, affectionate family members, striking a perfect balance between playfulness and the reliability of a hardworking herding dog.
Their vibrant personality and striking appearance make them a joy to discover and a wonderful addition to any dog-loving family.

data.general.name: Norwich Terrier
data.general.shortDescription: Norwich Terriers are plucky, faithful, and inquisitive little companions with a big-dog attitude.
data.general.longDescription:
Norwich Terriers are delightful little earthdogs known for their spirited personality and undeniable charm. Originating from their namesake town in England, these terriers stand only 10 inches tall and weigh around 12 pounds, embodying the phrase 'a big dog in a small package.' Their sturdy, stocky bodies are covered in a hard, wiry coat, giving them a rugged, working-dog appearance.
Historically bred as ratters, Norwich Terriers are tough and fearless, ready to take on any challenge despite their small stature. They are easily recognized by their erect, pointed ears, distinguishing them from their close relatives, the Norfolk Terriers.
These little dogs are full of life, often described as happy-go-lucky, and they thrive on both physical and mental stimulation. With a high activity level, they love to play fetch and engage in various games, but they are equally content to cuddle up on a lap. Their inquisitive nature makes them excellent watchdogs, always vigilant and ready to alert their owners of any unusual activity.
Norwich Terriers are incredibly affectionate with their families, earning a high rating for family affection and child-friendliness. They adapt well to different living environments, making them suitable for both city and country living. Training these intelligent but sometimes stubborn dogs is best done with short, positive sessions.
Their playful and friendly demeanor extends to strangers, making them wonderful companions for social households. With a lifespan of about 14 years, these cute and cuddly dogs promise years of joy and companionship.

data.general.name: German Pinscher
data.general.shortDescription: The vibrant, clever, and brave German Pinscher is a sleek, intelligent working dog.
data.general.longDescription:
The German Pinscher, a sleek and streamlined breed, is one of Germany's oldest and the prototype of many other pinscher breeds. Standing about knee-high to an average adult, this vibrant, clever, and brave dog boasts a shimmering coat that can be red, black, or blue with striking red accents. Beneath their smooth, straight fur lies a muscular build that moves with a strong, free-and-easy gait, embodying confidence and readiness for any adventure.
Originally bred as a rat catcher, the German Pinscher has evolved into a versatile working dog capable of various tasks. With their elongated, wedge-shaped head and dark, alert eyes, they exude a noble elegance. These dogs are highly intelligent and easy to train, making them excellent companions for active families.
They are affectionate with family members and protective when needed, making them loyal guardians. However, their high energy levels and need for mental stimulation require an owner who can keep up with their lively spirit. Friendly and playful, the German Pinscher enjoys engaging with people and other dogs, though they can be reserved with strangers.
Their grooming needs are minimal, and they tend to shed moderately. Overall, the German Pinscher is a delightful blend of elegance, intelligence, and spirited energy, perfect for those seeking a devoted and dynamic canine companion.

data.general.name: Ibizan Hound
data.general.shortDescription: The Ibizan Hound is a courteous, sociable, and serene rabbit courser with a sleek, elegant body.
data.general.longDescription:
The Ibizan Hound, with its lithe and leggy build, is a serene and sociable breed that hails from the Balearic Islands of Spain. This elegant dog, reminiscent of ancient Egyptian motifs with its elongated head and large, erect ears, is an excellent sprinter and leaper, needing ample space to run freely. Standing at around 25 inches tall and weighing about 50 pounds, the Ibizan Hound sports a smooth, wire coat in solid red, white, or a combination of both, beautifully complemented by amber or caramel eyes and rosy-colored nose, eye rims, and lips.
Known for their quiet grace, often described as deer-like, Ibizans are friendly and affectionate family dogs, excelling in social settings and getting along well with other dogs. While they have moderate protective instincts and adaptability, they require high levels of activity and mental stimulation. Their minimal shedding and low grooming needs make them a relatively low-maintenance breed.
With a lifespan of around 13 years, the Ibizan Hound is a delightful and elegant companion, perfect for active families who can provide the space and exercise this breed craves.

data.general.name: Presa Canario
data.general.shortDescription: The Presa Canario is a serene, self-assured guardian, known for its loyalty and protective instincts.
data.general.longDescription:
The Presa Canario, a moderately large molossoid breed, is distinguished by its serene demeanor and self-assured nature. With a robust and well-proportioned body, rectilinear profile, and signature black mask, this dog is both striking and powerful.
Historically used for herding cattle, the Presa Canario is especially suited to guarding, a role in which it excels due to its vigilant and firm stance when alert. Despite its calm appearance and attentive expression, this breed can be stubborn, requiring a confident and experienced handler for training.
With family members, the Presa Canario is obedient, docile, and exceptionally devoted, forming strong bonds with its master. However, it tends to be wary of strangers and has a protective instinct that is second to none, making it an excellent guardian.
This breed has a low, deep bark that can serve as an effective deterrent to potential intruders. Though not particularly playful or friendly towards children and other dogs, the Presa Canario's loyalty and protective nature make it a cherished companion for those who understand and appreciate its unique qualities.
Owners should be aware of the breed's moderate activity level and need for mental stimulation, along with its grooming needs, which are minimal due to its smooth, straight coat. The Presa Canario is a steadfast and imposing guardian, perfect for those seeking a devoted and protective companion.

data.general.name: Saluki
data.general.shortDescription: The elegant Saluki is a gentle, agile, and loyal hound with ancient, royal origins.
data.general.longDescription:
The Saluki, among the world's oldest dog breeds, has a history of being the esteemed hunting hound of kings for thousands of years. Renowned for their graceful, slim, yet robust build, Salukis epitomize athletic elegance with their long legs and perfect balance, reminiscent of a seasoned dancer or athlete. Standing at about 25 inches tall and weighing around 55 pounds, they are swift sprinters who revel in the thrill of a chase.
Salukis possess a gentle and dignified demeanor, coupled with an independent yet loyal nature, making them unique companions. Their smooth, straight coat comes in a variety of colors and patterns, requiring minimal grooming. Salukis are also known for their large, expressive, oval-shaped eyes that exude warmth and intelligence.
Highly adaptable, these magnificent hounds can thrive in diverse climates and environments. While their beauty and grace are captivating, owning a Saluki involves embracing their autonomous spirit and ensuring ample mental and physical stimulation to keep them content. Despite their noble lineage, Salukis are tender and affectionate family pets, though they may present certain challenges that demand patience and understanding.

data.general.name: Boerboel
data.general.shortDescription: The Boerboel is a serene, clever, and self-assured guardian devoted to protecting family and home.
data.general.longDescription:
Boerboels are formidable guardians, historically bred to protect remote South African homesteads from dangerous predators. Standing at around 25 inches tall and weighing up to 175 pounds, these dogs possess a broad, blocky head, powerful jaws, and a sleek, muscular build that showcases their lineage from the ancient 'molloser' dogs, the ancestors of today's mastiff breeds. Despite their imposing appearance, Boerboels are serene, clever, and self-assured, making them excellent protectors and companions.
Their agile movement sets them apart from other mastiff types, and their dominant yet trainable nature requires early training and socialization to prevent them from becoming overly dominant adults. Boerboels are bright and eager learners, thriving on mental stimulation and regular interaction with their loved ones.
With their unwavering loyalty and affectionate demeanor towards family members, they score high on family affection. However, their strong protective instincts and substantial size mean they may not be suitable for novice dog owners.
This breed's smooth, straight coat is easy to maintain, and while they shed moderately, their grooming needs are relatively low. Boerboels are moderately adaptable, somewhat sociable with other dogs, and have a balanced level of activity and vocalization.
While they might not be the most popular breed, their unique combination of intelligence, agility, and devotion makes them a beloved guardian for experienced owners.

data.general.name: Bearded Collie
data.general.shortDescription: The Bearded Collie is a vivacious, wise, and captivating herding dog with a shaggy, wavy coat.
data.general.longDescription:
The Bearded Collie, affectionately known as the 'Beardie,' is a boisterous and charismatic herding dog hailing from Scotland. Standing around 20 inches tall and weighing approximately 50 pounds, these dogs are covered in a distinctive shaggy, silky, wavy coat that gives them a charming, tousled appearance. With their dreamy, faraway gaze and lively personality, Beardies are truly captivating companions.
They are known for their friendliness and get along well with children and other animals, making them excellent family pets. Beardies are highly energetic and require ample outdoor exercise, thriving in active households. Though they can be willful due to their independent nature, they are also incredibly affectionate and amusing, providing endless laughter and joy.
Training should be engaging to prevent boredom, as these intelligent dogs need mental stimulation. The Bearded Collie's endearing traits and love for adventure make them the perfect sidekick for outdoorsy families.

data.general.name: Puli
data.general.shortDescription: The Puli is a sociable, faithful, and wise herder with a distinctive corded coat.
data.general.longDescription:
No other breed can be mistaken for the Puli, a compact but powerful herder known for its unique, profuse, naturally occurring corded coat. This agile and faithful dog stands about 15 inches tall and weighs around 30 pounds. The Puli is renowned for its sociable and wise nature, making it an excellent family companion.
Bred to work closely with humans, they are quick learners and exhibit a strong protective instinct. Their dense, wooly, and weatherproof cords require significant grooming but add to their charming and distinctive appearance. Known as the 'acrobat of the dog world,' the Puli's agility and light-footedness are impressive.
These dogs have moderate activity levels and thrive on mental stimulation, making training a delight due to their high intelligence and eagerness to please. While they may be reserved with strangers, they are affectionate with their families and adaptable to various living environments. The Puli's minimal shedding and low salivation tendency make them an appealing choice for those who appreciate a clean home, though their coat grooming needs are high.
With a lifespan of about 13 years, Pulik offer long-term companionship filled with loyalty and delightful antics.

data.general.name: Lakeland Terrier
data.general.shortDescription: The bold Lakeland Terrier is a zesty, brave, and self-assured small dog with a low-shedding, wiry coat.
data.general.longDescription:
The Lakeland Terrier, a spirited and zesty breed, embodies the essence of a 'big dog in a small package.' Originating from England's picturesque Lake District, this brave and self-assured terrier was historically a farmer's companion, adept at working in packs to protect livestock from foxes.
Standing at 15 inches and weighing around 17 pounds, the Lakeland Terrier boasts a sturdy and square frame, exuding a cocky swagger that belies its compact size. Their hard, wiry coat, which is low-shedding, comes in a variety of colors, often featuring a distinctive saddle mark on the back.
Characterized by their folded V-shaped ears, rectangular heads, and a mischievous twinkle in their eyes, Lakelands are true to the long-legged British terrier blueprint. They are incredibly affectionate with their families, scoring high in family affection and adaptability. Lakeland Terriers are moderately easy to train and require regular mental stimulation to keep their intelligent minds engaged.
They are playful and sociable, enjoying the company of other dogs and strangers alike. With low grooming and shedding needs, along with minimal salivation, they are relatively easy to care for. This breed's lively and brave nature, combined with their unique looks, make them a charming addition to any home.

data.general.name: Smooth Fox Terrier
data.general.shortDescription: The Smooth Fox Terrier is a lively, gregarious, and entertaining companion with a smooth, white coat.
data.general.longDescription:
The Smooth Fox Terrier, often hailed as the 'gentleman of the terrier world,' is a charming and spirited breed known for its lively and autonomous nature. Originally bred for traditional foxhunts in Britain, these terriers stand about 15 inches tall and weigh around 17 pounds, with a lifespan of up to 14 years. They have a dense, flat coat that is predominantly white with distinctive black, tan, or black-and-tan markings, and a V-shaped head.
Smooth Fox Terriers are known for their energetic and playful demeanor, making them delightful companions. They are highly affectionate with their families, displaying a strong protective instinct. These dogs adapt well to various living environments and are moderately easy to train, though they do require mental stimulation and regular physical activity.
With their friendly yet autonomous personality, Smooth Fox Terriers make for entertaining pets who thrive on interaction and adventure. Their smooth coat is relatively low-maintenance, adding to their appeal as a household pet. Despite their high vocalization frequency, their charm and lively presence more than make up for it, ensuring they bring joy and companionship to any home.

data.general.name: Mexican hairless dog
data.general.shortDescription: The serene, vigilant, and faithful Xoloitzcuintli is a smooth-skinned, ancient Aztec companion.
data.general.longDescription:
The Xoloitzcuintli (pronounced 'show-low-eats-QUEENT-lee'), also known as the Mexican Hairless Dog, is a serene and vigilant breed that dates back over 3,000 years. Once revered by the Aztecs as a sacred dog of the gods, today the Xolo is a devoted companion and alert watchdog. This breed comes in three sizes—toy, miniature, and standard—and two varieties: hairless and coated.
The hairless Xolo has tough, smooth skin, while the coated variety boasts a short, flat coat. Their colors range from black and gray-black to red, liver, and bronze. Known for their thoughtful and intelligent expressions, Xolos often have a wrinkled forehead when deep in thought.
Despite their elegant and graceful appearance, they are surprisingly strong and rugged. Highly adaptable, they thrive in various environments and require moderate exercise. With a lifespan of up to 15 years, these dogs form deep bonds with their families and excel in loyalty and protectiveness.
Their low grooming needs and minimal shedding make them an excellent choice for those seeking a unique, affectionate, and low-maintenance companion.

data.general.name: Welsh Springer Spaniel
data.general.shortDescription: The Welsh Springer Spaniel is a joyful, reticent, and positive medium-sized sporting dog with striking red and white coats.
data.general.longDescription:
The Welsh Springer Spaniel is a vigorous and joyful medium-sized bird dog known for its versatility in the field and affectionate nature at home. Standing around 18 inches tall and weighing approximately 45 pounds, this breed is larger than a Cocker Spaniel but smaller than an English Springer, making it a perfect 'handy size' for many dog lovers. With a lifespan of about 14 years, Welshies are known for their positive and reticent disposition, bringing a mix of enthusiasm and calmness to their families.
Their beautiful, wavy, silky red and white coats are not just for show—they are waterproof, weatherproof, and thornproof, allowing these dogs to excel in various climates and terrains. Highly trainable and adaptable, they score high in family affection, child-friendliness, and mental stimulation needs. They are moderately active and playful, making them great companions for active families.
Despite their friendly nature, they are somewhat reserved with strangers, providing a good balance of sociability and protective instincts. Low on salivation and moderate in shedding, their grooming needs are relatively manageable. Overall, the Welsh Springer Spaniel is a delightful breed that brings joy and companionship to any household, making it a cherished family member and an excellent sporting partner.

data.general.name: Borzoi
data.general.shortDescription: The Borzoi is a stately, faithful, and loving sighthound known for its grace and speed.
data.general.longDescription:
Among the most impressively beautiful of all dogs, the aristocratic Borzoi is cherished for its calm and agreeable temperament. These elegant sighthounds, once known as Russian Wolfhounds, were bred to be swift and tough, capable of pursuing and pinning ferocious quarry. With a height of at least 28 inches and weighing between 75 to 105 pounds for males, Borzois are large yet graceful.
Their luxurious, silky, curly coat adds to their majestic appearance. Despite their size, they are affectionate and gentle family dogs, though their dignified nature means they prefer a more serene environment over rough play. Borzois have a strong prey drive and need ample fenced-in space to run safely.
Training them requires patience and consistency due to their cat-like independence. With a lifespan of around 12 years, these stately dogs are a joy for those who appreciate their unique blend of strength, grace, and elegance.

data.general.name: Greater Swiss Mountain Dog
data.general.shortDescription: The Greater Swiss Mountain Dog is a reliable, sociable, and immensely strong working dog.
data.general.longDescription:
The Greater Swiss Mountain Dog is a large, immensely strong breed known for its striking black, red, and white tricolor coat. Standing up to 28.5 inches tall and weighing around 115 pounds, these dogs are impressive in both size and strength.
Historically, they earned their keep as dependable herders, drafters, and all-around pasture dogs. Swissies are highly reliable and faithful, making them exceptional companions for families. Their sociable nature means they get along well with children and strangers, while their protective instincts ensure they are always vigilant.
Despite their size, Swissies are agile and capable of moving flocks across mountainous terrain. They have a smooth, straight coat that requires minimal grooming, making them relatively low maintenance in terms of care. With an activity level that matches their working heritage, they thrive in environments where they can stay active and mentally stimulated.
